intro: Lobelia handelii, commonly known as the Cape York lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the wet tropical regions of northern Australia. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the wet season. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, which includes many other lobelias known for their ornamental value. Lobelia handelii is often found in rainforests and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in the local ecosystem.
